00030 void sqr(base_integer& target, const base_integer& n) {
00031     const digit_t *ndigits = n._get_digits();
00032     size_t nlen = n._get_length();
00033 
00034     integer r;
00035     r._realloc(nlen * 2 + 1);
00036     digit_t *rdigits = r._get_writable_digits();
00037 
00038     // Calculate the product of digits of unequal index
00039     size_t i = 0;
00040     doubledigit_t c;
00041     do {
00042         const doubledigit_t ii = ndigits[i];
00043         const digit_t *jp = ndigits + i + 1;
00044         digit_t *rp = rdigits + i + (i + 1), *rpe = rdigits + i + nlen;
00045 
00046         c = 0;
00047         while (rp < rpe) {
00048             doubledigit_t t = ii * *jp++ + *rp + c;
00049             *rp++ = static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00050             c = (t >> bits_per_digit);
00051         }
00052         *rp = static_cast<digit_t>(c);
00053     } while (++i < nlen - 1);
00054 
00055     // Multiplication of inner products by two
00056     c = 0;
00057     digit_t *rp = rdigits + 1, *rpe = rdigits + (2 * nlen) - 1;
00058     do {
00059         doubledigit_t t = (doubledigit_t(*rp) << 1) + c;
00060         *rp++ = static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00061         c = (t >> bits_per_digit);
00062     } while (rp < rpe);
00063     *rp = static_cast<digit_t>(c);
00064 
00065     // Addition of inner squares
00066     const digit_t *ip = ndigits, *ipe = ndigits + nlen;
00067     rp = rdigits;
00068     c = 0;
00069     do {
00070         doubledigit_t t = doubledigit_t(*ip) * *ip + *rp + c;
00071         *rp++ = static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00072         c = (t >> bits_per_digit);
00073 
00074         t = c + *rp;
00075         *rp++ = static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00076         c = (t >> bits_per_digit);
00077     } while (++ip < ipe);
00078     *rp += static_cast<digit_t>(c);
00079 
00080     r._cleanup();
00081     target._attach(r);
00082 }
00083 
00084 void pow(base_integer& target, const base_integer& n, const base_integer& e) {
00085     if (e._is_zero()) {
00086         // Anything to the zeroth power is one.
00087         target._set_unsigned(1);
00088         return;
00089     } else if (!e._is_zero() && e._get_negative()) {
00090         // Anything to a negative power is a fractional value, which an integer
00091         // library can't represent.
00092         target._set_unsigned(0);
00093         return;
00094     }
00095 
00096     bool neg=(!n._is_zero() && n._get_negative() && (e._get_digit(0) & 0x01));
00097 
00098     size_t length=e._get_length(), lastBitCount=0;
00099     digit_t ee(e._get_digit(length-1));
00100     while (ee != 0) { ee >>= 1; ++lastBitCount; }
00101 
00102     temp_t p(n);
00103     p._set_negative(false);
00104 
00105     // If target is a fixed integer, we want to calculate using the same
00106     // limitations on intermediate values.
00107     temp_t answer(target, 1);
00108     answer._set_unsigned(1);
00109     for (size_t eIndex=0; eIndex < length; ++eIndex) {
00110         digit_t eee(e._get_digit(eIndex));
00111 
00112         int bitCount(int(eIndex == length-1 ? lastBitCount : bits_per_digit));
00113         while (bitCount-- > 0) {
00114             if (eee & 0x01) multiply(answer, answer, p);
00115             sqr(p, p);
00116             eee >>= 1;
00117         }
00118     }
00119 
00120     answer._set_negative(neg);
00121     target._attach(answer);
00122 }
00123 
00124 void factorial(base_integer& target, size_t n) {
00125     // If target is a fixed integer, we want to calculate using the same
00126     // limitations on intermediate values.
00127     temp_t answer(target, 1);
00128     answer._set_unsigned(1);
00129 
00130     fixed_integer_any nn(n);
00131     while (nn > 1) {
00132         multiply(answer, answer, nn);
00133         nn._decrement();
00134     }
00135 
00136     target._attach(answer);
00137 }

00139 } // namespace detail

00152 integer pow2(size_t e) {
00153     integer r;
00154     setbit(r, e);
00155     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00156 }
00157 
00168 integer sqr(const integer& n) {
00169     integer r;
00170     detail::sqr(r, n);
00171     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00172 }
00173 
00182 integer pow(const integer& n, const integer& e) {
00183     integer r;
00184     detail::pow(r, n, e);
00185     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00186 }

00201 integer factorial(size_t n) {
00202     integer r;
00203     detail::factorial(r, n);
00204     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00205 }
